intro: Ruellia humilis var. frondosa, commonly known as the broadleaf ruellia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features heart-shaped, glossy green leaves and produces clusters of blue or purple tubular flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Ruellia humilis var. frondosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a ground cover.
